com.github.cwilper.fcrepo.store.core
Interface FedoraStoreSession

All Superinterfaces:
Iterable<FedoraObject>
public interface FedoraStoreSession
extends Iterable<FedoraObject>

A place to store Fedora objects and managed content.

Implementations should be presumed non-threadsafe unless explicitly stated.

Method Summary

Method Detail

addObject

void addObject(FedoraObject object)
Adds an object.

Parameters:
object - the object to add, never null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the object does not specify a pid.
NullPointerException - if the object is null.
ExistsException - if an object with that pid already exists.
StoreException - if there is any other problem.

getObject

FedoraObject getObject(String pid)
Gets an object.

Parameters:
pid - the pid of the object to get, never null.
Returns:
the object, never null.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the pid is null.
NotFoundException - if the object does not exist.
StoreException - if there is any other problem.

updateObject

void updateObject(FedoraObject object)
Updates an object. If any formerly-existing managed datastreams are no longer present, their associated content will be automatically deleted.

Parameters:
object - the object to update, never null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the object does not specify a pid.
NullPointerException - if the object is null.
NotFoundException - if the object does not exist.
StoreException - if there is any other problem.

deleteObject

void deleteObject(String pid)
Deletes an object. Any formerly-existing managed datastream content will be automatically deleted.

Parameters:
pid - the pid of the object to delete, never null.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the pid is null.
NotFoundException - if the object does not exist.
StoreException - if there is any other problem.

getContent

InputStream getContent(String pid,
                       String datastreamId,
                       String datastreamVersionId)
Gets the content of an existing managed datastream.

Parameters:
pid - the pid of the object in which the datastream resides, never null.
datastreamId - the id of the datastream, never null.
datastreamVersionId - the id of the datastream version, never null.
Returns:
the content, never null.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
NotFoundException - if the object, managed datastream, or content does not exist.
StoreException - if there is any other problem.

getContentLength

long getContentLength(String pid,
                      String datastreamId,
                      String datastreamVersionId)
Gets the length of the content of an existing managed datastream, in bytes.

Parameters:
pid - the pid of the object in which the datastream resides, never null.
datastreamId - the id of the datastream, never null.
datastreamVersionId - the id of the datastream version, never null.
Returns:
the content length in bytes.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
NotFoundException - if the object, managed datastream, or content does not exist.
StoreException - if there is any other problem.

setContent

void setContent(String pid,
                String datastreamId,
                String datastreamVersionId,
                InputStream inputStream)
Sets the content of an existing managed datastream.

Parameters:
pid - the pid of the object in which the datastream resides, never null.
datastreamId - the id of the datastream, never null.
datastreamVersionId - the id of the datastream version, never null.
inputStream - the content stream. Guaranteed to be closed by the time this method returns, regardless of success.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
NotFoundException - if the object or managed datastream does not exist.
StoreException - if there is any other problem.

close

void close()
Closes the session, releasing any resources held. It is safe to call this method multiple times. If an error occurs while closing, it will be logged rather than thrown. After this method is called, subsequent requests to other FedoraStoreSession methods will fail with an IllegalStateException.
